Introduction.

Hi, i guess you are here because you have purchased the awesome Chabod portfolio website template, if you have'nt, heres a link to do so right now - Buy Chabod Now

About Chabod.

Chabod is an amazing portfolio website template built with the bootstrap framework. Chabod comes with 6 different sections to help sellers show their professional profile, while remaining as engaging as possible. Chabod is a simple single page static website, with pop-up features like: a project story pop-up for sharing project stories, and a blog pop-up for displaying blog stories.

Getting Started.

Chabod is built with different front end web development tools and this documentation guides you through as much as is needed to get a hand an them and customize Chabod into the portfolio website of your dream.

Chabod is a straight forward portfolio website template. It's very well built and thus, leaves out the stress of needing to know how to use any of its components like paddings, margins, buttons and etcetera.
The only components that you might wish to know about, is the colour components.
Chabod comes with a black, white, and grey color build. This simple colour pallete adds greatly to it's simplicity.
All color configurations can be found in the config partial of both the light and dark modes - that is, the "light-mode-config.scss"   file and the "dark-mode-config.scss"   file).

Refer to the colours section below for more on handling colours in Chabod.

Chabod build Tools/Stack.

Chabod is built with the following tools:

  • HTML.
  • CSS.
  • SASS.
  • Bootstrap 5.
  • Ts Particles
  • Vanilla Javascript and
  • Gulp Js

Setting up your development environment.

Setting up your development environment to handle Chabod is pretty simple. Just lay a hand on any code editor of you choice like VS Code or Atom, open up the Chabod folder in the code editor, and we are good to go.

HTML.

Chabod is built with regular Html5 markup and Bootstrap 5. This means a good knowledge of the Bootstrap framework will help greatly in handling and customizing Chabod HTML.

CSS and SASS.

Chabod is built with SASS. SASS stand for "syntactically awesome stylesheet". SASS is a CSS preprocessor - it is a tool that provides a better and more cool way to write styles. SASS styles cannot be understood by your browser, as a result, SASS styles are processed into regular CSS which the browser understands. It is the processed SASS styles(CSS files) that are linked to in all the head section of the HTML files contained in Chabod.

The SASS styling in this template follows the component based styling system, this means each section of Chabod is styled seperately thanks to SASS partials - all the 6 different sections of Chabod are styled seperately in different files called partials. These seperations make further development and maintenance to be much easier compared to working directly with the jammed CSS files directly.

Feel free to work directly with the CSS files directly if you do not know how to work with SASS yet. You can find all the CSS files inside the "Styles" folder that is contained in the "Dist" folder in Chabod.

There are different ways to process SASS into CSS. But in this template, SASS is processed into CSS using Gulp.Js. Refer to the Gulp.Js section below for more on SASS compilation/processing. You do not need to bother a bit about SASS if Gulp is completely set up. So just set up Gulp, and go on with writing SASS - Gulp will automatically do the processing as configured in the "gulp.js" script.

But please, always remember to run the "gulp watch" command in your command line interface or Terminal, to ensure that gulp is watching for changes in any SASS files, so that it can process it into regular CSS. If you fail to do so, SASS will not compile/process into CSS and thus your changes will not be effected.

You can find all the main SASS files and SASS partials in the "Sass" folder that is inside Chabod.

Bootstrap.

Chabod is built with the Bootstrap 5 framework. Bootstrap is a very popular HTML, CSS and Javascript framework. It is very easy to set up. All the HTML files in Chabod contains CDN links to the Bootstrap framework for Bootstrap styles and all relevant scripts to get Bootstrap running.

This means that, as long as you are connected to the internet, you can just go ahead with customizing Chabod without needing any setup for Bootstrap.

If you prefer working offline with local bootstrap files, then go ahead and do the necessary downloads and linking to all the necessary files locally. The Bootstrap getting started page should have all the download links to the files that you can work with locally. So feel free to refer to the Bootstrap getting started page for all you will need to set up Bootstrap for local development.

Ts Particles.

Ts particles is a Javascript tool for creating particle effects in websites. The moving particle effect on the home section of Chabod is done by ts particles. Ts particles is a github fork of a similar javascript tool called Particles.js.

With Chabod, you do not need any set up for ts particles. it's all set up already. Both the light and dark modes of Chabod contains customized configurations for ts particles.

The particles effect on Chabod can be changed and customized to produce different particle effects of your choice. Refer to the Ts particles website for how to go about that. This tutorial might also be of great help.

Gulp.Js.

Gulp is a popular javascript tool for automating different development tasks like creating a live server, processing SASS, CSS auto-prefixing, etc

In this template, Gulp is used in SASS compilation and CSS auto-prefixing.

Chabod comes with a gulpfile.js script. That leaves you with no special Gulp.js script to write. All you'll need to do in to install gulp and all the required dependencies (gulp-sass, sass, and gulp auto-prefixer).

Follow these simple steps to get your Gulp.js all set up and functioning.

  • Install gulp on your PC (You'll need to have node.js installed first).
  • Initialize NPM in you project folder (the Chabod folder) by running the npm init command in the command line or terminal.
  • Then run the following command on the command line or Terminal to install all the required dependencies to get gulp all set for compiling SASS and auto prefixing CSS - npm install --save-dev gulp-sass gulp-autoprefixer sass

With all of these all done, You are ready to start enjoying Gulp.Js on your workspace, and you are all set to start building with SASS as well.

Colours

Chabod is built with a simple black, white and greyish color pallette. The reason for using such simple colour combinations is simply to avoid design complexities and also to ensure simplicity.

Both the dark and light modes of chabod are built with the same black, white and a greyish color combinations.

You can find all the color configurations in both the light-mode-config.scss file and the dark-mode-config.scss file for their respective modes.
